description:
<size=15>Objective:</size> recover a power core for the ship's engine. 

In the rebels escape from the Empire, the ship's power core was overloaded maintaining the ship's energy shield, at the same time as it was maximizing the output of the ship's engines. It is impressive they got as far as they did, considering they had no means of deceleration. The ship is currently running on a backup generator. It is imperative that a replacement core is installed. Should the ship run out of power, you along with the refugees will die from asphyxiation. My scanners have picked up a crashed vessel in a nearby asteroid. I detect no hostiles in the area. It is possible that the vessel contains a power cell compatible with our system, as the pirate ships are based on the same design as our own.

<size=15>Objective:</size> recover advanced scanners.

The rebel vessel is a transport ship; not a scout. As such, my scanners have limited range and utility. To improve your chances of survival you should see if you can't find a replacement. Logic based on information from my databanks suggests that the pirate frigates ought to have better developed scanners more suited for this environment. I have detected a large, inactive vessel in the Aukland Sector. It could be that it is derelict. If my estimated guess is correct, it is worth checking it out. Caution is advised, my scanners have picked up energy readings from the area. Likelihood of hostiles is very high.

<size=15>Objective:</size> recover aluminum plating. 

Certain rooms within our ship have been exposed to space. I've sealed them off, as to prevent unnecessary drain on our life support system. This is a short-term fix, however, and before we even think about leaving Adamec-14 we must repair these breaches. My scanners have spotted what seems to be an asteroid mining complex in the Leone Sector. While it might be considered a bit primitive, I believe we could use aluminium plating to patch up our hull. Stealth is advised. The pirates wouldn't leave such an operation unguarded.

<size=15>Objective:</size> disable an Imperial Battlecruiser. 

My scanners have picked up something massive. A more human expression would be: oh god, it's huge! The Imperial has sent a battlecruiser. I've examined every file within my databanks yet its designation is unknown to me. An estimated guess suggests it's a new model... and forgive the dramatic pause, it is outfitted with something that releases extreme heat signals. A super weapon. We won't be able to leave the system unless it is disabled.
